Student Question: can you tell me about Mahatma Gandhi
Response: Mahatma Gandhi, known as the "Father of the Nation" in India, was a prominent figure in the Indian independence movement. He advocated for nonviolent civil disobedience and civil rights, leading India to independence from British rule in 1947. Gandhi's philosophy of Satyagraha, based on truth and nonviolence, has inspired countless people worldwide and continues to influence social and political movements today.
